speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o. as Eddie_] Rrrr'appy Rrrr'irthday, Rrrr'aiser!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wakes up, sarcastically_] Eddie!  You can talk!

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o. as Eddie_] I've always been able to talk.  I just save it for special occasions like somebody's rrr'irthday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Eddie, thank you very much.  But listen, I'd like to talk about Dad.  I think his mind may be slipping.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, don't say things like that.  He's a dog, he might not know you're joking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, Dad, I didn't even know you were here! [_smirks_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just give me a couple more minutes and I'll have your birthday breakfast all ready.  Come on, Eddie!

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o. as Eddie_] Rrright behind you! _Frasier gives a glance out of the door as he begins to get up.  CUT TO: Living Room Martin is pouring some coffee as Frasier enters in his dressing gown._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, that's very nice, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, and look what I got.  A newspaper from the day you were born. [_hands it to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I keep telling you to clean out that closet of yours! [_sits down and reads it_]

speaker: Martin
text: I ordered it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, let's just see what other wonders occurred on that day. [_laughs and reads_] "SUSPECTED PINKO OUTED FROM CROSSING GUARD POST"  What a jolly world I was born into.

speaker: Martin
text: I know tonight's your party, but here. [_lights a candle on a cupcake_] Happy birthday!  Make a wish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Dad, thank you. _Frasier stands.  He bends over the table to blow it out -- and freezes. _

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Frasier
text: My back! [_in pain_] It's completely seized up!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, here...

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  It's been a little tender lately.  I went to see the doctor last week, he told me there was absolutely nothing wrong with it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, doctors never tell you anything, they're all just a bunch of overpaid quacks. [_off Frasier's glare_] Oh, I'm sorry, I don't mean you.  I'm talking about real doctors!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after he gives Martin a look_] How can this be happening to me?  I'm always so conscientious about back safety.  Why, just the other day when I needed that large heavy stack of books from down in the storage room, I insisted that Daphne make three trips.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know what, I've got that old girdle in my bedroom. Let me go get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, wait, I'm not going to wear anything called a girdle.

speaker: Martin
text: What if I call it a back-brace?

speaker: Frasier
text: Get it! _Martin does so and leaves the scene to his room.  Then the doorbell sounds.  Frasier sits still motionless._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calls_] Daphne!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God... Coming! [_slowly gets up and edges to the door_] This wouldn't be taking me so long if my housekeeper were here. [_finally opens door to Daphne_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm a physical therapist!

speaker: Frasier
text: Then perhaps you could get me into a chair!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_supports him_] Oh goodness, is your back bothering you again? Oh, I'm sorry I made you get up.  I forgot my keys.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps you should get a spare set made just to keep at Donny's.  For God's sake, you're practically living there as it is.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_guides him to sofa_] Oh, now, Dr. Crane.  You better get used to it.  Once I'm married, I will be living there. [_then_] I know what'll help that back, a nice massage.

speaker: Martin
text: Here we go.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, the girdle!  That'll help.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, it's kinda hard to put on by yourself.  But if Daphne holds one end and I hold the other, you can kinda spin into it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please Dad, this is humiliating enough as it is.

speaker: Martin
text: What's humiliating about it?  Look, you just hook it in the back like a bra.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just give me that! [_snatches it_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, does it bother you when I stay over at Donny's?

speaker: Martin
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it seems to bother Dr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's just cranky because of his back. _Daphne pours herself a cup of coffee, noticing the paper that Martin gave Frasier._

speaker: Daphne
text: Good Lord!  Queen Elizabeth had another baby!  I don't care what science can do, it's just not right.  [_N.B. A slight discontinuity here -- Frasier's birth year has been given as 1952.  Queen Elizabeth's second child, Princess Anne, was born in 1950, two years after her brother Charles.  Elizabeth did not give birth again until 1960._] _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Radio Station. Roz is preparing for the show in her booth.  Connie enters Frasier's booth with some flowers for Frasier, as Frasier hobbles inside with her, he is using a cane._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_referring to Connie placing the flowers on the console_] Oh, that'll be fine right there, be sure to thank the gang for the flowers, Connie.

speaker: Connie
text: You're welcome, Dr. Crane.  Happy Birthday. [_exits_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_realizes_] Birthday? [_then quickly_] Happy birthday, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz.  Not off to the best start though, my back is out.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you go home?  We'll just air "The Best of Crane." I'll drop your gift by later.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Roz.  I promised my listeners that I'd read a birthday address.

speaker: Roz
text: [_searching for a gift to give him_] Well, people might have forgotten, people do have busy lives, you know. [_notices a book on the side_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, I announced it twice.  Anyone paying the slightest attention would know. _Roz takes a gift bag with shoes in it, empties the shoes out and puts the book inside the gift bag._

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing over there?

speaker: Roz
text: Just, wondering when to surprise you with your... present! [_holds up gift bag_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, now is as good a time as any.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, we keep promising each other that we're not going to do this.  We've got to stop spoiling one another.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, what am I supposed to do?  Just forget your birthday?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks at book_] Oh, Good Lord, Roz.  You know, I read the most wonderful review of this recently.

speaker: Roz
text: I hope you like it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look, you've inscribed it.

speaker: Roz
text: [_worried_] I did?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads_] "You'll always be my baby."

speaker: Roz
text: I must have had a glass of wine when I wrote that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads_] "Love, Mom."

speaker: Niles
text: There's our bent and broken birthday boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: I've brought you a little gift.  Say hello to sweet salvation, the "Lumbar Log."

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles. [_takes it and props it behind his back_] I think the whole thing is probably stress-related.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's very possible.  Birthdays can be anxiety- provoking, especially for people of a certain age.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not "of a certain age," Niles.  I am smack dab in the middle of "not a kid anymore."  I won't be "of a certain age" for another ten years.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, if your back pain is stress-related, I read a magazine article with an exercise that might help.  You just go someplace where nobody can hear you and list all the things that bug you.

speaker: Frasier
text: In what esteemed medical journal did you find this little tidbit - "Cosmo"?

speaker: Roz
text: No, [_proudly_] "Glamour"!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's priceless.  "I can't find the right shade of lipstick," "I look terrible in a bikini," "He can't find my G-spot."

speaker: Roz
text: I said do it someplace private!

speaker: Niles
text: You know, it couldn't hurt, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, it's absurd.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm, the more you resist, the more I'm wondering if there's something you're trying to avoid.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thanks for backing me up, Niles.  You know, the same article said if you rub a raw potato...

speaker: Niles
text: If we're going to sell him on this, you should drop out now.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nobody's going to sell me on anything.  That sort of exercise only helps people who lack self awareness.  I for one am... [_spasm of pain_] God almighty!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, no wonder you're stressed, you've got a whole universe to run.

speaker: Roz
text: Thirty seconds, Frasier. [_enters her booth_]

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'll be off.  You take care of yourself, I'll see you tonight. [_exits_]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure you're up to this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll be fine, Roz.  I'm not as delicate as all that.

speaker: Roz
text: How did you do it anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Blowing out a cupcake.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, Frasier, we can always put on "The Best of Crane."

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Roz.  Now, just have a little bit of faith in me. I'm a lot tougher than that.  Tell you what, if I feel like I need help towards the end of the show, I'll give you a little signal, all right? [_shows her an example of her signal_]

speaker: Roz
text: All right, five seconds.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh you know, these flowers really are beautiful. [_on air_] Good afternoon, Seattle. _Frasier takes a sniff of the flowers, causing him to sneeze, forcing his back to move and causing him to scream in pain.  He sneezes again and screams again as Roz puts a hand to her earphones.  He sneezes a third time and falls off his chair in agony.  Niles runs in from the corridor as Frasier rolls around on the floor.  His hand comes up from under the console and signals Roz.  FADE TO:_ **EDWARD CRANE, PH.D.** _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. The apartment is empty as Frasier enters on the shoulder of Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello!  Anyone here? [_no reply_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess they're all out.

speaker: Niles
text: [_hurrying across room to sofa_] Okay, well let's just get you settled!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, slow down.  For God's sake, we're not running a three-legged race. [_falls onto sofa_] Do you have somewhere to be?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, since you bring it up, I do have a luncheon with my new lady love.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, gosh, I'd hate to have my pain stand in the way of that!  How could that orthopedist of yours tell me there was nothing wrong?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I looked at the x-rays myself, this is not a skeletal problem.  There, now you're all fine and I'm sure Dad will be by soon.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, wait.  This couch has absolutely no support. [_points to chair with ottoman_] Let's try that chair over there, please.

speaker: Niles
text: All right. [_picks him up_] You're not heavy, you're my brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: How could you take me to that unprofessional hack?  All he did was give me a bottle full of horse tranquilizers.  He didn't care about getting to the root of the problem, he just wanted to shut me up!

speaker: Niles
text: I think it might be time for one of those pills! _He settles Frasier on the chair in a most obscure way.  He is kneeling on the ottoman with his forehead resting on the chair back.  He looks like a contortionist._

speaker: Niles
text: All comfy?

speaker: Frasier
text: This won't do, it's even harder than a seat on a public bus.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, when were you ever on a bus?

speaker: Frasier
text: At a cocktail party once for the "Friends of Transit."

speaker: Niles
text: I wasn't invited to that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you just help me up, for God's sake! [_he does_] Oh God, you know, maybe I should take another one of those pills.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I'll get you a glass of water, okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. _Niles rushes into the kitchen and talks from offstage.  Whilst Niles is speaking Frasier takes the pills from his pockets and wanders over to Martin's chair slowly._

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] You know, things are really going well with Mel.  I've been out with her almost every night.  I don't want to jinx things but I dare say we're well on our way to becoming what might almost pass as an item. _Frasier falls down into Martin's chair as Niles enters with a glass of water._

speaker: Niles
text: I mean it, Frasier, she is just the... [_notices him_] Oh my God, did you fall?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm actually quite comfortable, Niles.  And look, there's no glare on the television... and here's a lovely place to set your drink. [_he does_]

speaker: Niles
text: Just give me your hand and whatever the chair's telling you, don't listen.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's helping my back actually.  You know, and when you sit in it, you don't have to look at it.

speaker: Niles
text: If you're really interested in correcting this problem and not just medicating it, you should consider that technique Roz mentioned - you know, listing your problems aloud.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, give me a break.

speaker: Niles
text: It's perfectly possible that this is connected to some submerged anxiety.  What's bothering you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, Niles, you really expect me to sit here all alone in some apartment, prattling on endlessly about my problems like some sort of a lunatic. [_Niles slowly leaves unnoticed by Frasier_] If you think I'm going to do that, you're the one who needs to get his head examined... _He notices Niles's disappearance.  Then Frasier sits quietly before Eddie runs from behind him and jumps onto his knee._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good God!  Oh, Eddie, please just shoo!  Get off me, get off me!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Do you want to know what's bothering me too?  Well, here's a start, I'm talking to a dog, that bothers me... I'm another year older today.  I suppose that bothers me, but not as much as people seem to think. [_takes pills_] I'm still single, that's a big one.  Not having a woman to share my life with.  The only women in my life are friends; Roz and Daphne.  Daphne's not even here anymore, she'll be married soon.  That's going to be tough on Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who am I kidding?  It's going to be tough on me.  It's been nice having her here.  Even when my love life hasn't been going so well, I can always come home to a warm and considerate woman.  You know, that's probably why I've been so brusque with her lately.  I know that once she's gone, I'll probably be twice as lonely.  Well, it's quite a realization, isn't it? _Daphne walks on in her dressing gown fresh from a shower, unnoticed by Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: I really do love Daphne and I'm about to lose her.  I've got to show her how I feel about her, while I still have the chance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know whether it was the therapy or the painkillers but I actually feel a bit better.  Let's try this. [_pulls himself to sit more comfortably on the chair_] Ah...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there are subtler ways to let the patient know his hour is up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane!  I didn't know you were here, I can't hear anything in that shower of mine, it's like a soundproof vault!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I wanted to apologize for being so short with you this morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's not.  It's never fine.  Listen, come here, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me a hug.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, do you know how much you mean to me?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_worried_] I'm getting an idea! _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne is sat at the dining table staring into space as Martin enters. He notices Daphne's behavior._

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] Hey, Daph. [_no response_] What's wrong?  Are you all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, actually no.  I overheard something I wasn't supposed to hear.  It's about Dr. Crane.  I overheard him say he's in love with me.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: And he wants to show me how much he loves me while he still has the chance.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez, not this!

speaker: Daphne
text: You knew about this?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not getting in the middle of this!

speaker: Daphne
text: Then it's true?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I kept my mouth shut for six years, I'm not saying anything now. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gobsmacked_] Six years?!  He's felt this way for six years?!

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s_] You didn't hear that from me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne.  Daphne, I can't lower myself into the tub.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, don't look at me!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I thought I'd skip the bath and take you up on that massage you offered.  Those expert hands of yours might be just what the doctor ordered. [_slyly_] Let's do it in my bedroom, shall we? _Daphne collects herself and slowly walks to Frasier's bedroom.  CUT TO: Frasier's Bedroom. Frasier is waiting as Daphne enters.  She is still in her robe._

speaker: Frasier
text: What kept you? [_Daphne murmurs_] Daphne, here, just help me out of this robe, please.  I nearly killed myself putting it on. _She does slowly and covers her eyes in case of "gratuitous nudity." She folds the robe up, glad to see that Frasier is wearing pants. He goes onto the bed and Daphne apprehensively goes to him._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_breathes_] Here we go!  Now, remember, your back's very tender, so no sudden movements. _Daphne slowly moves towards the back with her hands.  She is very scared.  Her fingertips press lightly onto his back and he lets out a groan of pleasure.  Daphne quickly removes her hands and gets off the bed._

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I'm catching a draft in this robe, perhaps I better change.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be waiting!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks back in disgust_] Ooh!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Did Daphne tell you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell me what?

speaker: Martin
text: She found out Niles has a thing for her.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: How?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, she said she overheard him earlier saying how much he loves her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God, no wonder she's been so distracted.  What did you say, did you confirm it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yes, I said I knew about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Well come on, what else was I going to say?!  And then I told her it was none of my business and I took off out of there.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinks_] Wait a minute!  How did she even see Niles today?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know, but she said she overheard him saying he loves her and that he wanted to tell her while he still has the chance.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realizes_] Oh, no!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I said that.

speaker: Martin
text: [_groans_] Oh, not you now!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, Dad, not that.  I was just doing a little exercise to try and help my back and I was talking out loud about how much I was going to miss Daphne.  She must have overheard me and misunderstood.

speaker: Martin
text: Who were you talking to?

speaker: Frasier
text: If you must know, I was talking to Eddie.

speaker: Martin
text: [_smirks_] Helps, doesn't it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it.  Thanks to you, now Daphne thinks I'm in love with her.  Here I am asking her for a massage, how is she expected to interpret that?!

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticing her_] Hard to say! [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just take a deep breath and try to relax.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's both do that, shall we? [_breathes deeply_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, Dad told me that you overheard me.

speaker: Daphne
text: He did?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I certainly picked the wrong person to confide in.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, I'm glad he told me, because the truth is you misunderstood.  You see, when I said how much I cared about you, I didn't mean it in a romantic sense.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hopeful_] Then you don't love me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, of course I love you, Daphne, but as a friend, that's all!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh thank God!  What a relief!  I mean I was flattered, but... [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's fine, off you go... [_his head spins_] Oh my, my head.

speaker: Daphne
text: It must be those pills.  Come on, let me give you that massage while you can still feel it.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. _Daphne takes her jumper off and pushes Frasier onto the bed.  She kneels beside him and massages him.  Frasier begins to relax._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Daph, we really are going to miss you around here.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's going to be hard for me too.  Something I haven't even wanted to think about - leaving.  I know I grumble a bit, but I do love you and your father.  I'll still come around though, we'll still see each other.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what?

speaker: Daphne
text: What's that, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad's chair.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not taking it with me if that's where you're heading. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: It's so comfortable!

speaker: Daphne
text: You took quite a few of those pills, didn't you? [_pause_] You know what's curious, though?

speaker: Frasier
text: Cats!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Yes!  But I'm talking about our little mix-up.  When I said to your father, "Dr. Crane's in love with me," he said it's been going on for six years now.  What did he mean by that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh that... he meant Niles! _KA-BOOM!!!  This revelation shocks Daphne into a state of confusion.  This is the turning point of the show._

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles... he's crazy about you!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_transfixed in mental conflict_] Dr. Crane? [_then to Frasier_] Dr. Crane! _But he's already fallen asleep.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Bedroom. A few hours later Frasier is woken up once again by Eddie with his voice box._

speaker: Martin
text: [_v.o. as Eddie_] Come on, Rrr'irthday Boy.  Wakey, Wakey, time for Cakey!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  Has a year passed already? _CUT TO: Living Room Meanwhile, the dining room table is set up with birthday decorations. Eddie, Martin and Daphne are wearing party hats._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_putting on her hat_] Please, the elastic's pinching behind my ears!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, it's just for a couple of hours.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's pulling my hair!

speaker: Martin
text: You don't hear Eddie complaining, do you? [_v.o. as Eddie_] I rr'uv my hat!

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I'm this close to breaking that thing into a million pieces!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't this festive!  Oh, Daphne, by the way, thank you for the massage, I think it did just the trick.

speaker: Daphne
text: Anytime, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, just before I drifted off I'm afraid I might have said something I wish I hadn't.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_worried_] Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's about Dad's chair, it may be comfortable but I still want to get it out of here.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_tense_] Oh, that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, I didn't say anything else I shouldn't have said, did I?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... [_then_] No, no.  And don't worry. [_points at chair_] Mum's the word!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] I'll get it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Did you straighten things out with Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I did.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that was a close one.  I almost blew Niles's secret!

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you try to be more discreet!  I can't pull your chestnuts out of the fire every time! _Daphne opens the door to Niles.  She looks very nervous and Niles can sense something is up._

speaker: Niles
text: Good evening, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_tense_] Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: You look different somehow. [_covering?_] Have you done something new with your hair? _Daphne points to her hat and takes it off, symbolically removing her badge of office.  She is now a new person._

speaker: Niles
text: That must be it! _Niles, confused by her actions, goes to greet Frasier and wish him many happy returns as Daphne looks him up and down from afar with silent eyes.  End of Act Two._
